title: Best early Black Friday Mac deals
content:
Macworld

Black Friday is the biggest shopping event of the year and in 2023 it falls on Friday, November 24. If you are looking for a great deal on a new Mac we’ll be checking all the best resellers in the U.S. and the U.K. to track down the best deals you can get in the Black Friday sales – and right now. We are here to help you save money on a new Mac for Black Friday.

We’ll start by sharing the best deals we have found so far, to give you an idea of what to expect, including some for the MacBook Air and MacBook Pro, but we also deal with Apple’s laptops elsewhere, see: Best Black Friday MacBook Deals.

We also share some shopping tips that should help you get the best deals available over Black Friday 2023.

Black Friday: Best Mac deals

These are the biggest savings we have seen for the iMac, Mac mini, MacBook Air, and MacBook Pro in the run up to Black Friday 2023:

Best Black Friday Mac mini deals

U.S.

  • Walmart: M2 Mac mini, 8/10-core, 256GB: $584 ($15 off MRSP $599)
  • Walmart: M2 Mac mini, 8/10-core, 512GB: $774 ($25 off MRSP $799)
  • Walmart: M2 Pro Mac mini, 10/16-core, 512GB: $1,239 ($60 off MRSP $1,299)

U.K.

  • Amazon: M2 Mac mini, 256GB: £579.99 (£69 off MRSP £649)
  • Amazon: M2 Mac mini, 512GB: £767.97 (£81 off MRSP £849)
  • Amazon: M2 Pro Mac mini, 512GB: £1,272 (£127 off MRSP £1,399)

For deals on all Mac mini Apple sells see our Best Mac mini deals round up.

Best Black Friday iMac deals

The iMac just gained an M3 chip, but we don’t expect to see many deals on that model yet. There are however savings to be had on the older M1 model that’s just been discontinued by Apple.

U.S.

  • Adorama: 24-inch M1 iMac (8-core CPU, 7-core GPU, 256GB): $1,249 (Was $1,299, $50 off)
  • Amazon: 24-inch M1 iMac (8-core CPU, 8-core GPU, 256GB): $1,486.95 (Was $1,499, $12 off)
  • Amazon: 24-inch M1 iMac (8-core CPU, 8-core GPU, 512GB): $1,659.99 (Was $1,699, $40 off)

U.K.

  • Amazon, 24-inch M1 iMac, 7-core GPU, 256GB: £1,227.97 (Was £1,399, £171 off – note Apple used to sell this model for £1,249).
  • Amazon, 24-inch M1 iMac, 8-core GPU, 256GB: £1,409.98 (Was £1,599, £189 off – note Apple used to sell this model for £1,449).
  • Amazon, 24-inch M1 iMac, 8-core GPU, 512GB SSD: £1,599 (Was £1,799, £200 off – note Apple used to sell this model for £1,649).

For deals on all 24-inch iMacs see our Best iMac deals round up.

Best Black Friday Mac Studio deals

U.S.

  • Expercom: Mac Studio M2 Max, 12-core CPU, 30-core GPU, 32GB RAM, 512GB SSD: $1,899.05 ($100 off)
  • DataVision: Mac Studio M1 Max, 10-core CPU, 24-core GPU, 512GB SSD: $1,749 ($250 off).
  • DataVision: Mac Studio M1 Ultra, 20-core CPU, 48-core GPU, 64GB RAM: $3,299 ($700 off original price).
  • Expercom: Mac Studio M1 Ultra, 20-core BPU, 64-Core GPU, 128GB RAM: $4,499 ($1,300 off original price of $5,799)

U.K.

  • AO, Mac Studio M2 Max: £1,904 (£195 off, MSRP £2,099).
  • AO.com, Mac Studio M2 Ultra: £3,799 (£400 off, MSRP £4,199).

See the Best Mac Studio deals available now.

Best Black Friday MacBook Pro deals

The MacBook Pro just gained an M3, M3 Pro and M3 Max chip, but we don’t expect to see many deals on those models yet. There are however savings to be had on the older M2-series models that have just been discontinued by Apple.

U.S.

  • Amazon, 13-inch MacBook Pro with M2 chip (256GB): $1,199 ($100 off, MSRP $1,299)
  • Amazon, 13-inch MacBook Pro with M2 chip (512GB): $1,299.99 ($200 off, MSRP $1,499)
  • Amazon, 14-inch MacBook Pro with M2 Pro chip (19-core GPU, 512GB): $2,359 ($340 off, MSRP $2,699)
  • Walmart, 14-inch MacBook Pro with M2 Max chip (30-core GPU, 1TB): $2,924 ($175 off, MSRP $3,099)
  • Walmart, 16-inch MacBook Pro with M2 Pro chip (19-core GPU), 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD: $2,364 ($135 off, MSRP $2,499)
  • Walmart, 16-inch MacBook Pro with M2 Pro chip (19-core GPU, 1TB): $2,499 ($150 off, MSRP $2,699)

U.K.

  • Laptops Direct, 13-inch MacBook Pro with M2 chip (10-core GPU), 8GB RAM, 256GB SSD: £1,219 (£130 off, MSRP £1,349)
  • Laptops Direct, 13-inch MacBook Pro with M2 chip (10-core GPU), 8GB RAM, 512GB SSD: £1,397.97 (£151 off, MSRP £1,549)
  • AO.com, 14-inch MacBook Pro with M2 Pro chip (16-core GPU), 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD: £1,950 (£199 off, MSRP £2,149)
  • Amazon, 14-inch MacBook Pro with M2 Pro chip (12-core CPU, 19-core GPU), 16GB RAM, 1TB SSD: £2,269.97 (£429 off, MSRP £2,699)
  • Amazon, 14-inch MacBook Pro with M2 Max chip (30-core GPU), 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD: £3,199 (£150 off, MSRP £3,349)
  • Amazon, 16-inch MacBook Pro with M2 Pro chip (19-core GPU), 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD: £2,279.97 (£419 off, MSRP £2,699)
  • eBuyer, 16-inch MacBook Pro with M2 Pro chip (19-core GPU), 16GB RAM, 1TB SSD: £2,573.34 (£325.66 off, MSRP £2,899)

Here are the Best MacBook Pro deals this month

  • Amazon, 13-inch MacBook Air, M1 (256GB): $849 ($150 off, MSRP $999)
  • Amazon, 15-inch MacBook Air, M2 (10-core GPU, 256GB): $1,049 ($250 off, MSRP $1,299)
  • Amazon, 15-inch MacBook Air, M2 (10-core GPU, 512GB): $1,249 ($249 off, MSRP $1,499)

U.K.

  • Amazon, 13-inch MacBook Air, M2 (512GB) £1,289.97 (£159 off, MSRP £1,449)
  • Amazon, 13-inch MacBook Air, M1 (256GB) £826 (£173 off, MSRP £999)
  • Amazon, 15-inch MacBook Air, M2 (256GB) £1,249.97 (£149 off, MSRP £1,399)
  • Amazon, 15-inch MacBook Air, M2 (512GB) £1,399 (£200 off, MSRP £1,599)

Take a look at the Best MacBook Air deals

Black Friday: Apple’s shopping event

Each year Apple holds a Black Friday four-day shopping event, but rather than offering discounts it just gives gift vouchers for certain products. In 2022 you could get gift cards with the following Mac purchases:

  • $100/£100 Apple gift card: Mac mini
  • $150/£150 Apple gift card: M1 MacBook Air, M2 MacBook Air, iMac 24-inch
  • $200/£200 Apple gift card: M2 MacBook Pro 13-inch
  • $250/£250 Apple gift card: MacBook Pro 14-inch, MacBook Pro 16-inch

Black Friday shopping tips

  • We often find the best savings are for older models.
  • Be sure to confirm what the generation is of the discounted model so that you know exactly what you are buying and what it’s really worth.
  • Sometimes resellers switch to selling refurbished or used products once their stock of brand new models run out. Make sure you check that the model discounted isn’t actually a used Mac and therefore not as good a deal as it might look. On Amazon, for example, look for Buy New prices.
  • Mac deals are not limited to Black Friday. There are good deals to be had all year round, so don’t feel pressured into buying during Black Friday.

Black Friday 2023: More Apple deals

Check out these roundups for even more Apple deals

Which resellers have the best Black Friday deals

Look out for the best deals over the Black Friday week, but many resellers are already offering Black Friday discounts.

U.S.

  • Adorama is advertising Holiday Deals.
  • Amazon has Holiday Deals.
  • Best Buy’s Black Friday sale has started.
  • B&H Photo has a Holiday Head Start sale.
  • Walmart’s Black Friday deals have already started.

U.K.

  • KRCS has already reduced Mac prices by 10%.
  • AO.com has various Black Friday savings.
  • Laptops Direct’s Black Friday sale has started.
  • eBuyer has a Black Friday Early Access Sale with up to 45% off.
  • Very‘s Black Friday sales is underway.
  • John Lewis is running Black Friday deals.
  • Currys has up to 40% off for Black Friday.
  • Argos has a price promise that the prices won’t go any lower for Black Friday.
  • Amazon’s Black Friday week starts on 17 November.
Mac
